{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3325048,"name":"","username":"MilkMan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/c5a1d2/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-05T23:08:18.076Z","cooked":"

Hello, I am trying to use photon vision to update the pose of our robot. I was wondering if the code we have would work for this. We are using a rpi 4 with a USB camera. If anyone could check it out, that would be greatly appreciated.

github.com

GitHub - ManOfAgua/SwerveCompV2_2024 at TestBranch

TestBranch

Contribute to ManOfAgua/SwerveCompV2_2024 development by creating an account on GitHub.

You absolutely can use PhotonVision to estimate your pose with CTRE swerve. Take a look a the PhotonPoseEstimator documentation. Once you get an estimated pose from Photonvision, you pass it to your drivetrain’s addVisionMeasurement method.

So if I call PhotonRunnable in the periodic of CommandSwerveDriveTrain (PhotonRunnable.run) will that constantly update the pose with vision measurements?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-03-06T21:27:30.595Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":322,"readers_count":321,"score":79.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":457447,"topic_slug":"photon-vision-pose-estimation-with-ctre-swerve","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":44380,"username":"gdefender","name":"Andy Gasser","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gdefender/{size}/168507_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61308,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/photon-vision-pose-estimation-with-ctre-swerve/457447/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3326183,"name":"","username":"MilkMan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/c5a1d2/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-06T21:28:45.696Z","cooked":"

I dont think I would call the grabLatestEstimatedPose method because that will only return the pose once, as the comment above the method says. But if I call the runnable I believe it will constantly update the pose?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-03-06T21:28:45.696Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":300,"readers_count":299,"score":90.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":457447,"topic_slug":"photon-vision-pose-estimation-with-ctre-swerve","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":61308,"username":"MilkMan","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/c5a1d2/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61308,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/photon-vision-pose-estimation-with-ctre-swerve/457447/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3329100,"name":"Andy Gasser","username":"gdefender","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gdefender/{size}/168507_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-10T16:23:16.759Z","cooked":"

That sounds like you’re looking at our code. You’re welcome to take what you want, but the class you’re looking at is intended to run on a background thread, and it’s probably more complex than what you need.

It’s easier to just use the PhotoPoseEstimator directly, probably just right in your drivetrain subsystem, or a separate command. Look at PhotonVision’s examples.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-03-10T16:23:16.759Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":263,"readers_count":262,"score":67.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":457447,"topic_slug":"photon-vision-pose-estimation-with-ctre-swerve","display_username":"Andy Gasser","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":61308,"username":"MilkMan","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/c5a1d2/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44380,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/photon-vision-pose-estimation-with-ctre-swerve/457447/5","custom_user_title":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3471365,"name":"Shishir Rajendran","username":"BluefaceBaby","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/47e85d/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-05T20:43:31.275Z","cooked":"

I looked at this but I ran into a couple of issues. The pose would update to the position of the april tag rather than its position relative to the april tag. Additonally it seemed that the pose was not updating properly or not updating at all continously. What are your thoughts?

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-01-05T20:43:31.275Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":213,"readers_count":212,"score":77.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":457447,"topic_slug":"photon-vision-pose-estimation-with-ctre-swerve","display_username":"Shishir Rajendran","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":44380,"username":"gdefender","name":"Andy Gasser","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gdefender/{size}/168507_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58042,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Baby"},"post_url":"/t/photon-vision-pose-estimation-with-ctre-swerve/457447/6","custom_user_title":"Baby","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3471719,"name":"Andy Gasser","username":"gdefender","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gdefender/{size}/168507_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-06T00:37:10.125Z","cooked":"

Do you have any code you can share?

BluefaceBaby:

The pose would update to the position of the april tag rather than its position relative to the april tag.

I can’t think of any reason this would happen, unless I’m misunderstanding what you’re saying. Are you saying the robot pose updates to the location of the tag on the FRC field?

The pose will only update when you feed it a new measurement from PhotonVision, so be sure you are doing that iteration.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-01-06T00:37:10.125Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":195,"readers_count":194,"score":54.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":457447,"topic_slug":"photon-vision-pose-estimation-with-ctre-swerve","display_username":"Andy Gasser","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44380,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/photon-vision-pose-estimation-with-ctre-swerve/457447/7","custom_user_title":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3471732,"name":"Shishir Rajendran","username":"BluefaceBaby","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/47e85d/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-06T00:56:24.871Z","cooked":"

I used this exact code from the documentation

    public Optional<EstimatedRobotPose> getEstimatedGlobalPose(Pose2d prevEstimatedRobotPose) {
        photonPoseEstimator.setReferencePose(prevEstimatedRobotPose);
        return photonPoseEstimator.update();
    }

And then in my drivetrain periodic I add the vision measurement as such but I use a hardcoded standard deviations rather than a method to calculate it as I was trying to get the simplest version of pose estimation done.

        visionEst.ifPresent(
                est -> {
                    // Change our trust in the measurement based on the tags we can see
                    var estStdDevs = vision.getEstimationStdDevs();

                    drivetrain.addVisionMeasurement(
                            est.estimatedPose.toPose2d(), est.timestampSeconds, estStdDevs);
                });

When I mean the pose was updating to the location of the tag: no matter where we move the robot, the robot pose would update to a location very near to where the april tag was. It wasn’t a relative adjustment of the robot. Rather, it was the same repetetive adjustement. I can get you a visualization of what this means tommorrow.

I also want to try the photon pose estimation example from the photonvision github, but it seems to be out dated. I will have to look through and see what needs to be updated when I try the example later.

Thanks

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-01-06T00:56:24.871Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":182,"readers_count":181,"score":86.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":457447,"topic_slug":"photon-vision-pose-estimation-with-ctre-swerve","display_username":"Shishir Rajendran","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":44380,"username":"gdefender","name":"Andy Gasser","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gdefender/{size}/168507_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58042,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Baby"},"post_url":"/t/photon-vision-pose-estimation-with-ctre-swerve/457447/8","custom_user_title":"Baby","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3472519,"name":"Andy Gasser","username":"gdefender","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gdefender/{size}/168507_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-06T16:15:01.355Z","cooked":"
BluefaceBaby:

When I mean the pose was updating to the location of the tag: no matter where we move the robot, the robot pose would update to a location very near to where the april tag was. It wasn’t a relative adjustment of the robot. Rather, it was the same repetetive adjustement.

Yeah, you’re going need to provide a visualization, I don’t understand. The pose estimate will be an estimate of where the camera/robot are in relation to the tag. So if the camera is near the tag, the pose estimate will be near the tag. It shouldn’t be a relative adjustment, it should be an absolute pose on the field that it determined relative to the tag(s) seen by the camera.

However ideally, my code should work given the right standard deviations correct? Sorry I couldn’t get the visualization today, we were busy designing.
